lines.text: "July 25. We have been assured by Major Wallace that there will be a rest for us when we reach Berlin. The fighting has been hard, the strain almost unbearable. I will receive the Medal of Honor from General Eisenhower but the heroism of 'B' Company will be preserved by the men who have seen us fight and die."
Hey boy, what are you standin' there for?
Hey boy, you better get some latrines dug!
[Second soldier throws a shovel at the wounded Pvt. Crunk. Captain Carter picks it up and slams it against the bridge railing]
